title: Practical 1 – Introduction to R
text:
Question 1


Hide code
data <- airquality
na_rows <- which(rowSums(is.na(data)) > 0)
na_rows

[20]  53  54  55  56  57  58  59  60  61  65  72  75  83  84  96  97  98 102 103

Question 2


Hide code
library(knitr)

summary_table <- data.frame(
  Variable = c("Ozone", "Temperature"),
  Mean = c(mean(data$Ozone, na.rm = TRUE), mean(data$Temp, na.rm = TRUE)),
  SD = c(sd(data$Ozone, na.rm = TRUE), sd(data$Temp, na.rm = TRUE)),
  Min = c(min(data$Ozone, na.rm = TRUE), min(data$Temp, na.rm = TRUE)),
  Max = c(max(data$Ozone, na.rm = TRUE), max(data$Temp, na.rm = TRUE))
)

kable(summary_table, 
      digits = 2, 
      caption = "Descriptive Statistics for Ozone and Temperature",
      col.names = c("Variable", "Mean", "Std. Deviation", "Minimum", "Maximum"))

Question 3


Hide code
cars_data <- cars
Y <- cars_data$dist
X <- cbind(1, cars$speed)


beta_mat <- solve(t(X) %*% X) %*% (t(X) %*% Y)
beta_hat <- data.frame(
  Term = c("Intercept", "Speed"), 
  Estimate = as.matrix(beta_mat)
)

kable(beta_hat, digits = 4, 
      caption = "Manual Model Coefficients",
      col.names = c("Term","Coefficients"))



Manual Model Coefficients


Term
Coefficients

kable(model$coefficients, digits = 4, 
      caption = "LM Model Coefficients",
      col.names = c("Coefficients"))

Question 3

Question 3.1
The ‘OO’ carrier contains only a single observation for Month 1; consequently, the standard deviation is undefined (NA), as a minimum of two data points is required to calculate variance.

  filter(month == 1)

title: Practical 4 - Tidyverse
text:
Question 5


Hide code
fast_flights <- 
  flights %>% 
  mutate(speedy = dep_delay > 0 & arr_delay <= 0) %>% 
  summarise(
    speedy_count = sum(speedy, na.rm = T),
    speedy_prop = speedy_count/length(speedy)*100
  )

kable(fast_flights)





speedy_count
speedy_prop




35442
10.52391

  arrange(desc(ave_delay))

title: Practical 2 - Questions 4 & 5
text:
Question 5


Hide code
library(car)

n <- 1000
rep <- 1000
sim <- sort(rt(n, 1))

sim_norm <- sort(rnorm(n))
envelope <- replicate(rep, sort(rnorm(n)))
lower <- apply(envelope, 1, quantile, probs = 0.025)
upper <- apply(envelope, 1, quantile, probs = 0.975)

par(mfrow=c(2, 1))
plot(sim~sim_norm, ylim = c(-10,10), main = "Simulated QQ Plot")

abline(0,1, lwd = 1, col = "blue")
lines(sim_norm, lower, lwd = 2, col = "blue")
lines(sim_norm, upper, lwd = 2, col = "blue")

invisible(qqPlot(sim, envelope = 0.95, ylim = c(-5, 5), main = "Library Generated QQ Plot"))
